info.title: Accounting Extension
info.description:
These APIs allow you to interact with HubSpot's Accounting Extension. It allows you to:
* Specify the URLs that HubSpot will use when making webhook requests to your external accounting system.
* Respond to webhook calls made to your external accounting system by HubSpot

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: Operations to interact with URL settings for an external accounting system.

tags.name: Callbacks
tags.description:
Endpoints that an external accounting system should call when it has finished performing a task requested by HubSpot.
_Note that all responses to the callback endpoints should contain a `"@result"` field, that has a value of either `"OK"` or `"ERR'`, which indicates if the response represents a success or failure of the requested task._

tags.name: UserAccounts
tags.description: Operations to inform HubSpot about some required account details for users in an external accounting system.

tags.name: Sync
tags.description: Operations to synchronize external accounting system contacts and products with HubSpot.

post.description: Call this endpoint with the response to a customer creation request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The ID of the request that this response is for

requestBody.description: The ID of the created customer.

post.description: Call this endpoint with the response to a customer search request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The ID of the request that this response is for

requestBody.description: The result of the customer search request.

post.description: Call this endpoint with the response to an exchange rate request.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The ID of the request that this response is for

requestBody.description: The result of the exchange rate request.

post.description: Call this endpoint with the response to a invoice creation request.

parameters.description: The ID of the request that this response is for

requestBody.description: The ID of the created invoice.

post.summary: Endpoint for PDF content of invoice
post.description: Call this endpoint with the PDF content of a requested invoice.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The ID of the request that this response is for

requestBody.description: The bytes of the invoice PDF.

get.description: Returns invoice data for an Accounting account from the specified ID

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: The ID of the invoice. This is the invoice ID from the external accounting system.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account that the invoice belongs to. This is the account ID from the external accounting system.

patch.description: Updates an Invoice by the given ID.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: The ID of the invoice. This is the invoice ID from the external accounting system.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account that the invoice belongs to. This is the account ID from the external accounting system.

post.description: Records an payment against an invoice.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: The ID of the invoice. This is the invoice ID from the external accounting system.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account that the invoice belongs to. This is the account ID from the external accounting system.

get.description: Returns the URL settings for an accounting app with the specified ID.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the accounting app. This is the identifier of the application created in your HubSpot developer portal.

put.description: Add/Update the URL settings for an accounting app with the specified ID.  All URLs must use the `https` protocol.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the accounting app. This is the identifier of the application created in your HubSpot developer portal.

post.description: Imports contacts' properties from an external accounting system to HubSpot. Import details, including property mappings, must be configured previously in HubSpot infrastructure.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the accounting app. This is the identifier of the application created in your HubSpot developer portal.

post.description: Imports products' properties from an external accounting system to HubSpot. Import details, including property mappings, must be configured previously in HubSpot infrastructure.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the accounting app. This is the identifier of the application created in your HubSpot developer portal.

put.description: Creates an account which contains the information about the account in the external accounting system.  This *must* be called after a user connects their HubSpot account to the external accounting system, as there is no other way for HubSpot to obtain the external account details.

requestBody.description: The external accounting system user account information.

delete.description: Deletes a user account from HubSpot, meaning that HubSpot will no longer send requests to the external accounting system for this user.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the user account to delete.

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

products.description: The list of products that matched the search criteria.

ProductSearchResponse.description: A response to a search for products.

enabled.description: Indicates if importing invoices from the external account system into HubSpot.

ImportInvoiceFeature.description: Indicates if importing invoices from the external account system into HubSpot is supported for the integration.

countrySubDivisionCode.description: A region of the county of the address.  May represent county, state etc.

lineOne.description: The first line of the address.

Address.description: Represents an address of a customer

toHubSpot.description: Indicates if syncing the object type from the external accounting system into HubSpot is supported.

createCustomer.description: Indicates if a new customer can be created in the external accounting system.

taxes.description: Indicates if taxes can be specified by the HubSpot user for line items.

exchangeRates.description: Indicates if the external accounting system supports fetching exchange rates when create an invoice in HubSpot for a customer billed in a different currency.

terms.description: Indicates if the external accounting system supports fetching payment terms.

invoiceComments.description: Indicates if a visible comment can be added to invoices.

invoiceDiscounts.description: Indicates if invoice-level discounts can be added to invoices.

CreateInvoiceSubFeatures.description: Lists the individual aspects of creating invoices that are enabled for the integration, as part of the create invoice flow in HubSpot.

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

terms.description: The list of payment terms that matched the search criteria.

TermsResponse.description: A response to a search for payment terms.

AccountingFeatures.description: Outlines the features that are supported by the external accounting system.

taxExempt.description: Identifies if the product is tax exempt or not.

name.description: The display name of the product.

description.example: Website design, Online advertising and SEO.

id.description: The ID of the product in the external accounting system.

Product.description: Representation of a product in the external accounting system.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the currency used in the invoice to bill the recipient

dueDate.description: The ISO-8601 due date of the invoice.

externalRecipientId.description: The ID of the invoice recipient. This is the recipient ID from the external accounting system.

isVoided.description: States if the invoice is voided or not.

receivedByCustomerDate.description: The ISO-8601 datetime of when the customer received the invoice.

invoiceNumber.description: The number / name of the invoice.

InvoiceUpdateRequest.description: The invoice data to update in HubSpot

code.description: The code/ID of the tax in the external accounting system.

percentage.description: The tax percentage.  For example, 8.05 represents a 8.05% tax rate.

name.description: The display name of the tax.

Tax.description: Representation of a tax defined in the external accounting system.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

customers.description: The list of customers that matched the search criteria.

CustomerSearchResponseExternal.description: A response to a search for customers.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when the product was updated in the external accounting system.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the currency of the product price.

id.description: The ID of the product in the external accounting system.

properties.description: A map of key-value product properties to be imported.

UpdatedProduct.description: A request to import external accounting product properties in HubSpot

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

ResultIdAccountingResponse.description: A response to the creation of an entity (eg. invoice, customer).

dueDate.description: The due date for payment of the invoice, in ISO-8601 date format (yyyy-MM-dd)

customerId.description: The ID of the customer that this invoice is for.

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the currency of this invoice.

invoiceLink.description: A link to the invoice in the external accounting system.

customerName.description: The name of the customer that this invoice is for.

status.description: The currency status of the invoice.

AccountingExtensionInvoice.description: Representation of an invoice in the external accounting system.

accountId.description: The id of the account in your system.

accountName.description: The name of the account in your system. This is normally the name visible to your users.

currencyCode.description: The default currency that this account uses.

CreateUserAccountRequestExternal.description: Information about the account in your external account system.

amountPaid.description: The amount that this payment is for.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the currency of the payment.

paymentDateTime.description: The datetime that this payment was received.

externalPaymentId.description: The id of this payment in the external accounting system.

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

taxes.description: The list of taxes that matched the search criteria

TaxSearchResponse.description: A response to a search for taxes.

dueDate.description: The due date for payment of the invoice, in ISO-8601 date format (yyyy-MM-dd)

name.description: The display name of the payment terms.

id.description: The ID of the payment terms in the external accounting system.

dueDays.description: The number of days that these payment terms represent.

AccountingExtensionTerm.description: Representation of payment terms that are defined in the external accounting system. One of 'dueDays' or 'dueDate' is required.

getInvoiceUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where invoices can be retrieved.

searchCustomerUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where a customer search can be performed.

getInvoicePdfUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where an invoice PDF can be retrieved.

customerUrlTemplate.description: A template URL that indicates the endpoint where a customer can be fetched by ID. Note that ${CUSTOMER_ID} in this URL will be replaced by the actual customer ID. For example: https://myapp.com/api/customers/${CUSTOMER_ID}

productUrlTemplate.description: A template URL that indicates the endpoint where a product can be fetched by ID. Note that ${PRODUCT_ID} in this URL will be replaced by the actual product ID. For example: https://myapp.com/api/products/${PRODUCT_ID}

invoiceUrlTemplate.description: A template URL that indicates the endpoint where an invoice can be fetched by ID. Note that ${INVOICE_ID} in this URL will be replaced by the actual invoice ID. For example: https://myapp.com/api/invoices/${INVOICE_ID}

createInvoiceUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where an invoices can be created.

searchInvoiceUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where an invoice search can be performed.

searchProductUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where a product search can be performed.

getTermsUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where payment terms can be retrieved.

createCustomerUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where a new customer can be created.

searchTaxUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where a tax search can be performed.

exchangeRateUrl.description: A URL that specifies the endpoint where exchange rates can be queried.

AccountingAppUrls.description: The URL endpoints that HubSpot will send requests to an external accounting system for certain actions.

externalInvoiceNumber.description: The invoice number. Note that this is _not_ the ID of the invoice, but the number that the billed customer will see.

totalAmountBilled.description: The total amount that this invoice is for.

balanceDue.description: The remaining balance due for the invoice.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the currency of the invoice.

dueDate.description: The due date of the invoice

externalRecipientId.description: The id of the customer in the external accounting system that the invoice was sent to.

receivedByRecipientDate.description: The datetime that that invoice was sent to the customer.

externalCreateDateTime.description: The datetime that the invoice was created in the external accounting system.

isVoided.description: Indicated is the invoice has been voided or not.

createdAt.description: The datetime that the invoice was created in HubSpot.

updatedAt.description: The datetime that the invoice was last updated in HubSpot.

externalAccountId.description: The id of the account in the external accounting system that this invoice is related to.

id.description: The id of this invoice in the external accounting system.

InvoiceReadResponse.description: The invoice data stored in HubSpot

appId.description: The ID of the accounting app. This is the identifier of the application created in your HubSpot developer portal.

AccountingAppSettings.description: The URL Settings, which defines the URL endpoints that HubSpot will send requests to an external accounting application for certain actions.

id.description: The ID of the customer in the external accounting system.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the currency the customer should be billed in.

AccountingExtensionCustomer.description: Representation of a customer in the external accounting system.

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

invoices.description: The list of invoices that were found for the request.

InvoicesResponseExternal.description: A response to a request for invoices.

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

invoices.description: The list of invoices that matched the search criteria.

InvoiceSearchResponse.description: A response to a search for invoices.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

updatedAt.description: The timestamp (ISO8601 format) when the customer was updated in the external accounting system.

id.description: The ID of the customer in the external accounting system.

customerType.description: Designates the type of the customer object.

UpdatedContact.description: A request to import external accounting contact properties in HubSpot

enabled.description: Indicates if creating invoices in HubSpot is supported for the integration.

CreateInvoiceFeature.description: Indicates what elements of creating invoices in HubSpot is supported for the integration.

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

invoice.description: The bytes of the invoice PDF.

InvoicePdfResponse.description: A response that contains the PDF of an invoice

@result.description: Designates if the response is a success ('OK') or failure ('ERR').

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate between the 2 currencies

sourceCurrencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the source currency of the exchange rate.

targetCurrencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code that represents the target currency of the exchange rate.

ExchangeRateResponse.description: A response to the request for an exchange rate value. It represents the exchange rate from the source currency to the target currency.

accountId.description: The ID of the account in the external accounting system. This is the value that will be passed as `accountId` for all outbound calls for the user from HubSpot to the external accounting system.

products.description: A list of products to be imported.

SyncProductsRequest.description: A request to import external accounting product properties in HubSpot

code.description: The code/ID of the tax in the external accounting system.

name.description: The display name of the tax.

TaxType.description: Represents a tax in the external accounting system.

taxIncluded.description: Indicates if the unit price amount already includes taxes.

accountId.description: The ID of the account in the external accounting system. This is the value that will be passed as `accountId` for all outbound calls for the user from HubSpot to the external accounting system.

contacts.description: A list of contacts to be imported.

SyncContactsRequest.description: A request to import external accounting contact properties in HubSpot
